intro: Erica wittebergensis, commonly known as the Witteberg heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Erica wittebergensis is well adapted to Mediterranean climates and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
